revised_title: Investigating the Influence of Screens on Magnetic Action and the Power of Iron Masses to Control Magnetic Attraction
tldr: The author, William Snow Harris, investigates the influence of screens on the progress of magnetic action and the power of iron masses to control the attractive force of a magnet. He discovers that every substance susceptible of magnetism by induction tends to arrest the action of a magnet when interposed as a screen, and that the screening power depends on the mass of the interposed substance. He also explores the neutralizing power of iron masses and suggests that a temporary magnetic state may be induced in a substance through the immediate action of the magnet or through the action of each particle of the substance on the next in succession.
